Bachata and kizomba are both great styles to explore! I don't have real-time information about specific studios or classes in your city, but I can give you some suggestions on how to find them:

1. **Google search**: Try searching online for "bachata classes near me" or "kizomba classes in [your city name]". This should give you a list of nearby studios or schools that offer these classes.
2. **Dance studio directories**: Look for online directories that list dance studios and schools in your area. Some popular directories include DanceStudioFinder, DanceClass, or Studios.com.
3. **Social media and online forums**: Search for Facebook groups or online forums focused on dance in your city. You can ask about bachata or kizomba classes and get recommendations from other dancers.
4. **Ask Maria or other dancers**: Ask your instructor Maria or other dancers you know if they've taken bachata or kizomba classes in the city. They might be able to recommend a studio or instructor.
5. **Check out local community centers**: Many community centers offer dance classes, including bachata and kizomba. They might not be as well-known as private studios, but they can be a great option.

When searching for studios, make sure to read reviews, check the schedule, and look for beginner-friendly classes or workshops. It's essential to find a studio and instructor that fit your style and learning preferences.

Remember to also ask Maria about her experience with bachata or kizomba, as she might have valuable insights or recommendations. She might even be able to introduce you to other instructors or studios in the city!
